title: Sydney temperature drops 14C in half an hour on Friday following scorching temperatures of 34.7C
text:
Temperatures across Sydney dramatically dropped by 14 degrees in half-an-hour as a scorching heatwave came to an abrupt end.

A blistering high of 34.7C was recorded in New South Wales around 12.30pm on Friday but temperatures dramatically dropped to a cool 19.8C in just half-an-hour in Mascot.

According to Weather Zone, there was a 10C difference in Mascot and Observation Hill.

As temperatures peaked to a high of 34.7C in Sydney, beachgoers were left scrambling to their cars after the weather plummeted 14C (Bondi Beach)

A scorching high of 34.7C was recorded in the state around 12.30pm but temperatures dramatically dipped to a cool 19.8C in just half-an-hour in Mascot

Bankstown, Campbeltown and Olympic Park however still reported temperatures in the 30s and would have taken a while to cool down.

The sudden change brought the blistering heatwave to an abrupt end ahead of the long weekend, with light showers expected on Friday night and early on Saturday morning.

A much cooler weekend is expected around Sydney across the east coast which will eventually make its way up the coast.

Temperatures in Sydney are expected to soar to 34C on Friday and could reach 40C in north Queensland over the weekend. The forecast for 4pm on Friday is pictured

Up the coast in Queensland, Brisbane enjoyed a toasty 28C on Friday and the mercury will rise to 34C early next week, 11C above average for this time of year

Up the coast in Queensland, Brisbane enjoyed a toasty 28C on Friday and the mercury will rise to 34C early next week, 11C above average for this time of year.

'During the weekend, that hot air mass will push all the way towards the east coast, leading to near record high October temperatures,' said Sky News Weather chief meteorologist Tom Saunders.

Adelaide enjoyed 27C on Friday but the hot plume won't quiet reach further south with Melbourne and Hobart both topping at 16C.

Melbourne will heat up on Saturday, however, the mercury will only hit 27C.
